title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 272-1.13 - Fabricated steak
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 272-1.13 - Fabricated steak

State Regulations

Fabricated beef steaks, veal steaks, beef and veal
steaks, or veal and beef steaks, and similar products, such as those labeled
"Beef Steak, Chopped, Shaped, Frozen," "Veal Steaks, Beef Added, Chopped-Molded-Cubed-Frozen, Hydrolized Plant Protein, and Flavoring," shall be
prepared by comminuting and forming the product from fresh and/or frozen meat, with or without added fat, of the species indicated on the label. Such products
shall not contain more than 30 percent fat and shall not contain added water, binders or extenders. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
§§
272-1.13

New

York State Register December 21, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 51, eff. 12/21/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
